editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Quaestiones Hebraicae in Genesin
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus sancti Ieronimi presbiteri in libro questionum Hebraicarum
msItem.incipit: Qui in principiis librorum debebam secuturi
In principio ...; Plerique aestimant sicut in altercatione
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber questionum hebraicarum sancti Ieronimi in Genesi

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: De Mansionibus Filiorum Israel (Epist. 78)
msItem.rubric: Incipit eiusdem qui supra de mansionibus filiorum Israel
msItem.incipit: In septuagesimo septimo Psalmo quem iuxta euangelistam Matheum ex persona Domini dictum credimus

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: Quaestiones Hebraicae in libros Regum et Paralipomenon
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati Ieronimi presbiteri de questionibus Regum
msItem.incipit: Fuit uir unus de Ramathaim Sophim ...; Ramathaim interpretatur excelsa duo
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber eiusdem de questionibus Paralyppomenon
msItem.incipit: In diebus eius diuisa est terra. Quia in diebus eius facta est turris
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber de mansionibus filiorum Israhel (corr. in the margin by a slightly later hand)

msItem.author: Eusebius
msItem.title: De Situ et Nominibus Locorum Hebraicorum
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati Ieronimi presbiteri de distantiis locorum
msItem.incipit: Eusebius qui a beato Pamphilo martyre cognomentum sortitus est
msItem.note: CPL 581a (prol.); PL 23. 859–928; ed. E. Klostermann, GCS 11/1 (1904); Stegmüller, Bibl. 3304; Lambert 202.

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: De Decem Temptationibus
msItem.incipit: Hec sunt uerba quae locutus est Moyses ad omnem Israel in transitu Iordanis ...; Haec sunt uerba quibus corripuit Moyses filios Israel

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: De Sex Ciuitatibus ad quas Homicida fugit
msItem.rubric: De sex ciuitatibus ad quas homicida fugit

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: In Canticum Deborae
msItem.incipit: Cecineruntque Debbora et Barach filius Abinoem. Baruch uir Debbora prophetidis fuisse traditur

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: In Lamentationes Ieremiae
msItem.incipit: Et factum est postquam in captiuitatem ductus est Israel ...; Sicut inter omnia cantica uaeteris et noui testamenti

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: Ad Dardanum de Diuersis Generibus Musicorum (Epist. 23)
msItem.incipit: Cogor a te ut tibi Dardanae de aliis de generibus musicorum
msItem.note: PL 30. 213–15, here ending four sentences before the conclusion of the printed text; Lambert 323.

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Ad Rusticum Monachum (Epist. 125)
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola beati Ieronimi ad Rusticum monachum
msItem.incipit: Nichil Christiano felicius cui promittuntur regna caelorum

msItem.title: De Sphaera Caeli
msItem.rubric: Incipit de spera caeli et de diuersis scripturis
msItem.incipit: (fol. 106) Paulus apostolus non ab hominibus neque per hominem ...; Apostolus interpretatur missus
(fol. 116v) Abraham pater excelsus. Vocabitur nomen eius admirabilis consiliarius

msItem.title: Interpretations of biblical words
msItem.incipit: In Genesi. Sintagma doctrina, Oeconicon dispensatorem uel secretum
msItem.explicit: (De Iohannis epistola tercia) Diotrepes heresiarcha temporis illius aliquis superbus
msItem.note: Also in e.g. Alençon, Bibl. mun. 2, 15, CUL Gg. 1. 5, Madrid, Bibl. naz. 91 (and see below).

Arts 1–2, 4, 3, 5, 7–9, 12 (titled ‘De partibus minus notis ueteris testamenti’), and 11, are found in that order in Cambridge, Trinity Coll. B. 2. 34 (s. xii in., Christ Church, Canterbury), and O. 4. 7 (s. xii in., Rochester). Cambridge, Emmanuel College 57 (s. xii in., provenance unknown), has arts 1–2, 4, 3, 5–8, 12, 11.

On the rear pastedown is a table of contents, s. xv. There are also faint notes in pencil, one beginning ‘Willelmus Asaha[?m]’ . Toward the end of the book are large, unattractive profile faces as nota-marks in the margins.

supportDesc.extent:
120 leaves 295 190
190 130
The edges lightly retrimmed and stained yellow.
supportDesc.collation: 1–158; the quires numbered, sometimes at the beginning, sometimes at the end.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 34 lines. Pricked in the inner (and therefore originally both) margins. Flyleaves and the pastedown are lost from the front.

handDesc.handNote: An expert English protogothic bookhand of ‘west country’ type.

decoDesc.decoNote: Arabesque initials in 2–3 of red, blue and green. On fol. 1 is a 9-line redQenclosing foliate ornament in the colours. Otherwise plain red or green initials.

binding.p: Similar to MS 46 (12th century, reworked c. 1500); tawed skin over flush, square-edged oak boards, sewn on three bands; plain headband, blue and plain tailband. A central strap from a recess in the front board to a pin replaced by a catch at the rear, all lost. The mark of a large brass chain-staple, succeeded by a smaller one, near the foot of the foredge of the front board. On the front cover is written ‘Hieronymus’, s. xvii.

history.acquisition: Probably made at a religious community in south-west England, at the College by 1600. At the head of fol. 1 is ‘N. 4. 12. Art:’, s. xvii, canc., and the James no. ‘266’. ‘12’ is inked on the foredge. Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a table of contents, s. xvii, and two modern shelfmarks in red ink, ‘A. 1. 12 (LI)’, and ‘E. 1. 5’, both canc. in favour of ‘P. 1. 6’. The College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
